reviews.review_msg: Good prof, hes funny and clearly is passionate about first nations. Exams were fair and werent hard as long as you understand the slides!
Nice professor, fair marking, and caring. Interesting lectures as well

This would have been an easy A if I actually studied. Lectures were enriched with documentaries he chose to include. I realized so many issues around Indigenous people and communities because of him and this course. I find him a little awkward, but he's a kind person(maybe bc first time professor?)! if possible, do take FNST101 before you graduate!
First semester ever teaching a course and he has done a great job. Very kind and approachable. Is not intimidating at all and is a fair marker. Exams are fair too.
